paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: increased risk of heart failure development

individual_records.phenotype_details: increased risk of heart failure development
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In a study that included 3,856 African-Americans, 124 carriers were detected, and over a follow-up period of 21.5 years, those patients were at increased risk of heart failure development, but there were no statistically significant differences in mortality.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with increased risk of heart failure but specific segregation data is not provided.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on population studies.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is the most common point mutation associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The V122I variant, where isoleucine is substituted for valine, has a prevalence of approximately 3% in African-Americans and is the most common point mutation associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

patients.phenotype: commonly affects the nerves and the heart

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is known to affect both nerve and heart function.

variants.evidence_level: Limited evidence based on demographic associations.
variants.additional_notes: Early cardiac involvement is not as frequent in Val30Met.
key_quotes: Other genetic variants include Val30Met (Any, Portuguese, Spanish) and Thr60Ala (Irish), both of which commonly affect the nerves and the heart.

patients.phenotype: commonly affects the nerves and the heart

functional_data.summary: The Thr60Ala variant is known to affect both nerve and heart function.

variants.evidence_level: Limited evidence based on demographic associations.
variants.additional_notes: Early cardiac involvement is not as frequent in Thr60Ala.
key_quotes: Other genetic variants include Val30Met (Any, Portuguese, Spanish) and Thr60Ala (Irish), both of which commonly affect the nerves and the heart.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant TTR variants were extracted successfully.
